title: spack view copy should use patchelf instead of search and replace
body:
Currently, `spack view copy` does a low-level search the source prefix path in the binaries and replace it with the destination prefix path.

It would be better to do this using `patchelf`, either to do the same thing, or even to strip rpath from the binary.

### Rationale

<!--*Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it!*-->
When the destination prefix is longer than the source prefix, the search/replace in the binary strategy fails.

In my case, I end up applying patchelf anyway outside spack afterwards to remove rpaths because I need to be able to copy the libs where I want. 

It is therefore quite frustrating that the `spack view copy command` fails because of the impossibility to update some rpaths that I do not care about and end up erasing in the end.

### Description

<!--*Describe the solution you'd like and the alternatives you have considered.*-->
Several solutions would solve my problem

1. add an option to bypass the search/replace or continue when it fails
2. use patchelf instead or in complement of the search/replace strategy
3. add an option to erase the rpath, using patchelf

### Additional information
<!--*Add any other context about the feature request here.*-->


### General information
